alert.note: Alert for Middlesex; New Haven; New London (Connecticut) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued September 11 at 3:10PM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...A portion of southern Connecticut, including the following counties, Middlesex, New Haven and New London. * WHEN...Until 615 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low lying and poor drainage areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 310 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms. Minor flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the advisory area. Between 1/2 and 1 inch of rain has fallen. - Additional rainfall of up to 1/2 inch inch is expected. - Some locations that could experience minor flooding include... Middletown, Wallingford, Guilford, Colchester, East Hampton, Durham, Salem, North Branford, Portland, East Haddam, Haddam, Lebanon, Killingworth, Middlefield, Madison, Franklin, Moodus and Higganum. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads.
